availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen F. Farrow (Caldwell Co, KY, attorney)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Judge Kenaz Farrow and Susan French Farrow. Married to Roberta Stockton Farrow in Mason County, Kentucky, on October 7, 1856. Father of Susan Farrow. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1850. Attorney in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 13B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 113.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, 1851-1864, Film #000281844.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 83.
